WorkItem.Description:
Hi,
I am using the control on a page with the AjaxControlToolkit 3.5 (ToolkitScriptManager) and am getting the above error from the following script code (which appears to result in the dropdown portion of the control not working).

DropDownScript.prototype.init = function () { var a = this; if (typeof Sys != "undefined") { Sys.WebForms.PageRequestManager.getInstance().add_endRequest(function (c, b) { a.initEvents(); }); }

While I would still like a solution for getting the DropDownCheckBox control working with a ToolkitStriptManager,  I might point out that the above codes representation invarient gives the rule  "PageRequestManager must not be null"  because it has the dependency  .getInstance() that requires a valid object reference.    Since it [PageRequestManager] appears to be null in some cases (and is thus creating an exception to the rule), one might want to add some exception handling.
WorkItem.Summary: PageRequestManager: object is null or undefined
